title: Let A and B be two events. Suppose that the probability that neither event occurs is 3 8. What is the probability that at least one of the events occurs? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are 4 possible situations: Event A occurs, but not event BEvent B occurs, but not event ABoth event A and event B occurNeither event A nor event B occurThe total probability for these situations is 1. P(event A or event B or both occur) = P(event A only) + P(event B only) + P(event A and event B) must then be equal to 1 - P(neither A nor event B occur) because all 4 must add up to 1.
